messages.subject: Unschooling and jobs
messages.msgSnippet: PS - the blog noted is blood pressure raising ;-) however I did recognize some names from this list with great response posts ;-) Just to give you all a bit
messages.messageBody:
"PS - the blog noted is blood pressure raising ;-) however I did
recognize some
names from this list with great response posts ;-)"

Just to give you all a bit of background, the owner of that blog (the
blood-pressure raising one) started this whole thing by coming to MY
blog and posting a comment about us being "child abusers". He later
retracted that (sort of), but I actually used his rude comment as a
blog post instead of letting it through as a comment.

When I shared the info. with UB members, several of them went to
comment at his site. He keeps posting about unschooling. It's been
interesting.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Unschooling and jobs
messages.msgSnippet: You don t need a book.  The evidence is
messages.messageBody:
<<I wish someone would write a book about how unschoolers can make a living
doing things they love without college>>

You don't need a book. The evidence is all around you. I posted about my
brother the chemist who flunked out of college. I have a graduate degree
but haven't used it in years. I teach karate and raise goats (both of which
I love).

Johnny Depp dropped out of high school and when he decided he was crazy and
tried to go back, the principal told him "No really, please don't." And
encouraged him to follow his passions.

If you follow your heart and are willing to work hard, you can make a
living. Perhaps not a fortune, but a living.

Julie
